info.title: EKM Partner API
info.description:
Our new API allows partners to build significantly better integrations with the EKM platform.

To try out the below endpoints, or for full up to date representations of the request / response models, please see the [swagger page](https://api.ekm.net/swagger/index.html). (We display examples here, but the swagger page is guaranteed to show the complete model.)

To keep up to date with the latest updates, please see our [RSS feed](https://partners.ekm.net/ChangeLog/Feed) or the [partner dashboard](https://partners.ekm.net/).

get.description:
The SEOFriendlyUrl property can be combined with the primary shop domain to get the shop page url for a Product in the format:
{primary_domain}/{SEOFriendlyUrl}

post.summary: Set a product to be managed by another category

400.description: The product already exists in the category

404.description: No product or category for that ID found

delete.summary: Stops a product from being managed by another category

404.description: The product does not exists in the category

get.description:
Images stored on EKM servers will have the location property of the response set to the path of the image file. This will need to be prepended with the shop's domain.
Remote images will have the remote property of the response set to the URL of the image.
Images that have been deleted will have the location property of the response set to "No image available."

404.description: No product for that ID found

post.summary: Assign an image by Url to a product
post.description:
An example URL request path would look something like:
            
    https://api.ekm.net/api/v1/products/5/images/1?imageurl=https://www.ekm.com/images/design/en-AU/logo.svg

200.description: The images assigned to the product

404.description: The product does not exist

Bearer.description: In order to ensure the safety of our users data, we require all partner applications to register via the [Partner Dashboard](https://partners.ekm.net/). Once registered, partners are provided with an application key, which can be used during an OAuth2 handshake to create a token. This token can then used to make requests on behalf of a merchant. We have a [Guide](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Y26QJmrXi6NBID34E4M6G9D0_A-jLiNtGb9kHvGw69A/edit?usp=sharing) on using OAuth2 that many people find helpful.

scopes.profile: Read a user's details. (name, email, etc)
scopes.tempest.orders.customers.notes.read: Read a shop's order customer notes.
scopes.tempest.orders.customers.notes.write: Modify a shop's order customer notes.

tags.name: OData
tags.description:
We make use of a [third party library](https://github.com/jlamfers/XPression/)
to provide us with OData $filter syntax support for our search endpoints, but
this library only supports a [subset of the OData syntax](https://github.com/jlamfers/XPression/blob/5e61157400264c96615e9e53b272ebefede97182/XPression/Language/Syntax/ODataSyntax.cs).
Most basic queries will work but only specific functions are supported (e.g. contains)

We perform ordering via a separate `orderby` parameter. You can pass any field name
in the response to order by that field. Prefixing the field with '-' will sort
in descending order.

For example, sorting products by id, ascending:

`/api/v1/products/search?page=1&limit=10&orderby=id&query=contains(tolower(name), 'ekm')`

Or sorting by name, descending:

`/api/v1/products/search?page=1&limit=10&orderby=-name&query=contains(tolower(name), 'ekm')`

tags.name: Plan Restrictions
tags.description:
We have several plans ([Viewable here](https://www.ekm.com/ecommerce/cost)) with different features and restrictions.
These restrictions are enforced by returning a `PlanRestrictionViolation` error.
The value of this error is the `Id` of a Restriction on the shop's current [Plan](#tag/Plans).

Plan Restrictions' contain a UI friendly message for display to the merchant when appropriate, as well as the Id of the Plan
that the merchant would need to upgrade to in order to overcome this restriction.

tags.name: Rate Limits
tags.description:
We make use of the leaky bucket algorithm to limit the rate that clients can make requests to a given merchants data.

Limits are currently only applied between a given application and merchant, not to the application as a whole.

When an application exceeds its rate limit, the API will begin responding with 429 (Too Many Requests) status codes until there is enough
allowance to serve the request.

| Configuration Item | Value | Description |
|---|:-----:|-----------|
| Request Cost | 1 | Each request adds a single token to the bucket |
| Bucket Size | 40 | The bucket can contain a maximum of 40 tokens at any time |
| Leak Interval | 1 second | The bucket leaks once per second |
| Leak Amount | 2 | The bucket leaks 2 tokens per interval |

All of this information is also sent back on every request in the headers, so that consumers can monitor it for changes.

| Header Name | Corresponding Configuration Item |
|-------------|----------------------------------|
| X-EKM-RateLimit-Cost | Request Cost |
| X-EKM-RateLimit-BucketSize | Bucket Size |
| X-EKM-RateLimit-LeakRate | Leak Interval |
| X-EKM-RateLimit-LeakAmount | Leak Amount |
| X-EKM-RateLimit-Remaining | The amount of allowance available after this request |

### Example 1
An application makes 2 requests per second for a single merchant.
Each second, 2 requests are added to the bucket, and removed as the bucket leaks.
The application can continue this way indefinitely, as it is not reducing its allowance.

### Example 2
An application makes 3 requests per second for a single merchant.
Each second, 3 requests are added to the bucket, and 2 are removed by the leak.
After 40 seconds the application runs out of allowance, and begins receiving 429 status codes.

### Example 3
An application makes 40 requests at 10:00:00 am for a single merchant.
From that point on it continues to make 2 requests per second to the same initial merchant.
The application can continue this way indefinitely, although it has no extra allowance to cope with a burst of activity.
If the application has a quiet period later with less requests, the bucket will gradually empty.

### Example 4
An application makes 40 requests in a single second to Merchant A.
The same application then makes a request in the same second to Merchant B.

All of these requests are ok, as the rate limit has not been exceeded for any given merchant.

tags.name: Support
tags.description:
As an approved API Partner of EKM, you can benefit from specific technical support for API integrations. While we can only offer a limited amount of support to partners we hope that this support helps you integrate with our platform seamlessly.

*Please note that we cannot offer partners advice about how or what to build to achieve their requirements.*

If you require technical support please submit a support request by completing the following form **[here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScCHK2VkEA_b4jdwnQ_pHPjuxJzyVJchs_P-tpZpoYmc4nLyg/viewform).** Providing us with this information will help our support teams to diagnose your issue.

tags.name: Refresh Tokens
tags.description:
When an application successfully completes the access code flow, we will transmit an access code and a refresh token.
The access code expires after 1 hour and to get another you must make a request to the token endpoint using the refresh token.
The request should be a `POST` request to: `https://api.ekm.net/connect/token` including a body with content type of `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` in the following format:

`client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret}&grant_type=refresh_token&refresh_token={refresh_token}&scope={scopes}`

| Variable | Description |
|:-----------------:|-------------------|
| client_id | Your applications Client Key, which can be found in the Tokens modal on the partners applications page. |
| client_secret | Your applications Client Secret, which can be found in the Tokens modal on the partners applications page. |
| refresh_token | The refresh token that you were given when receiving the access token. |
| scopes | A space separated list of scopes. These scopes must be selected in the Required Permissions section of the partners applications page for each individual application. **Please note, the "offline_access" scope should be added to the list of scopes in order to receive refresh tokens.** |

You should receive a new access code, as well as a new refresh token.

**Please note: Refresh tokens are usable on a one time only basis. When trying to obtain a new access code by making a request to `https://api.ekm.net/connect/token` with the same refresh token more than once will result in an error.**

Refresh tokens expire 15 days from their most recent usage.

Access to the API will continue to be granted, as long as :-
- The refresh token is used within 15 days.
- Consent has not been revoked by the user.

If your applications refresh token expires, you must go through the access code flow again.
